title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Finished Sopranos.Best TV series I have ever watched.

"Don't look up" is a must watch political satire and very relevant to kind of nationalistic politics, crony capitalism and corruption that we see in current India especially after the way the government handled the pandemic..
Saw 83 in a theatre, good movie.
Sopranos is the greatest tv show of all time!
The Wheel of Time season 1 and Witcher season 2. Great month for fantasy fans. Both shows were amazing.
Not The Wire?
I am watching the wire now
Watching Super Crooks on Netflix. Not as good as The Invincible, but still pretty decent.
"minnal Murali", superhero movie done right.. Probably one of the best if not The best superhero origin movie from India
The Pentagon officer charging 10 USD for a snack inside White House is one great cinematic pieces I have seen in recent times. Satire so on point xD
I have read all Foundation books and I found the series to be meh!
Sneha babu is her name lol
Yeah it was pretty bad. Only Lee pace was good.
Not Band of Brothers?
I felt it was an okay movie. The attempt was good but it felt lacking somewhere.
The WoT was ao good! Rosamond Pike is great! Cannot say the same for Witcher although the acting is on point but the story was meh.
Same goes for WoT. The series was pretty meh compared to the books

I have read the first three WOT books too and the show does stray and drop a lot of things, but still stays true to the source material. Foundation on the other hand was plain boring and nowhere close to the books.
I watched Mindhunter on Netflix, thought it was great
Sopranos is good, but The Wire is the best for me.

Didn't like WoT that much. Last episode felt like a letdown. Witcher was good.

Also do check out The Expanse. Very good sci-fi
Yes, I have been meaning to start Expanse.
1883 is a new western show that came out recently, if you're a fan of Yellowstone you'll love this.

light_cleaned_comments: Finished Sopranos.Best TV series I have ever watched. "Don't look up" is a must watch political satire and very relevant to kind of nationalistic politics, crony capitalism and corruption that we see in current India especially after the way the government handled the pandemic.. Saw 83 in a theatre, good movie. Sopranos is the greatest tv show of all time! The Wheel of Time season 1 and Witcher season 2. Great month for fantasy fans. Both shows were amazing. Not The Wire? I am watching the wire now Watching Super Crooks on Netflix. Not as good as The Invincible, but still pretty decent. "minnal Murali", superhero movie done right.. Probably one of the best if not The best superhero origin movie from India The Pentagon officer charging 10 USD for a snack inside White House is one great cinematic pieces I have seen in recent times. Satire so on point xD I have read all Foundation books and I found the series to be meh! Sneha babu is her name lol Yeah it was pretty bad. Only Lee pace was good. Not Band of Brothers? I felt it was an okay movie. The attempt was good but it felt lacking somewhere. The WoT was ao good! Rosamond Pike is great! Cannot say the same for Witcher although the acting is on point but the story was meh. Same goes for WoT. The series was pretty meh compared to the books I have read the first three WOT books too and the show does stray and drop a lot of things, but still stays true to the source material. Foundation on the other hand was plain boring and nowhere close to the books. I watched Mindhunter on Netflix, thought it was great Sopranos is good, but The Wire is the best for me. Didn't like WoT that much. Last episode felt like a letdown. Witcher was good. Also do check out The Expanse. Very good sci-fi Yes, I have been meaning to start Expanse. 1883 is a new western show that came out recently, if you're a fan of Yellowstone you'll love this.
